Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: Allison is a young woman whose world falls apart when she survives an unimaginable tragedy. While in recovery for an opioid addiction and unresolved grief, she forms an unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law, Daniel, that gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together. Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: General Leslie Groves Jr spearheads the Manhattan Project to research and develop a devastating weapon capable of ending the Second World War. J Robert Oppenheimer and his colleagues subsequently risk destroying humanity to create an atomic bomb. Christopher Nolan's Bafta and Oscar-winning biopic, starring Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt.(n)

programme.title: L'immensità
programme.desc: In 1970s Rome, a mother contends with her loveless and abusive marriage while caring for her children, one of who is experiencing gender dysphoria and wishes to identify as a boy. Family drama, starring Penélope Cruz, Vincenzo Amato and Luana Giuliani. In Italian.(n)

programme.title: You Can Live Forever
programme.desc: After moving into a Jehovah's Witness community, lesbian teenager Jamie begins a life-changing love affair with the daughter of a prominent Witness Elder. Drama, starring Anwen O'Driscoll and June Laporte.

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Finding You
programme.desc: Violinist Finley Sinclair travels to an Irish coastal village to begin her semester studying abroad. At the B\u0026B run by her host family, she encounters the gregarious and persistent heartthrob movie star Beckett Rush. Romantic drama, starring Rose Reid, Katherine McNamara, Vanessa Redgrave, Jedidiah Goodacre and Judith Hoag.

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.

programme.title: A Good Person

Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: She Came To Me
programme.desc: A composer who suffers writer's block rediscovers his passion after an adventurous one-night stand. Writer/director Rebecca Miller's comedy drama, starring Peter Dinklage and Anne Hathaway.

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: General Leslie Groves Jr spearheads the Manhattan Project to research and develop a devastating weapon capable of ending the Second World War. J Robert Oppenheimer and his colleagues subsequently risk destroying humanity to create an atomic bomb. Christopher Nolan's Bafta and Oscar-winning biopic, starring Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby, and his dying mother Gwen. Helen's life is a grind, but she has a chance at romance when a secret love returns. Writer/director Janis Pugh's drama, starring Louise Brealey and Annabel Scholey.

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.

programme.title: Finding You
programme.desc: Violinist Finley Sinclair travels to an Irish coastal village to begin her semester studying abroad. At the B\u0026B run by her host family, she encounters the gregarious and persistent heartthrob movie star Beckett Rush. Romantic drama, starring Rose Reid, Katherine McNamara, Vanessa Redgrave, Jedidiah Goodacre and Judith Hoag.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: She Came To Me
programme.desc: A composer who suffers writer's block rediscovers his passion after an adventurous one-night stand. Writer/director Rebecca Miller's comedy drama, starring Peter Dinklage and Anne Hathaway.

programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.

programme.title: Dance First
programme.desc: In 1969 Stockholm, Samuel Beckett is due to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony attended by his wife Suzanne and dignitaries. As he ascends the stage to accept the honour, Beckett sparks a conversation with himself about events and people that have led him to this point. Drama, starring Gabriel Byrne and Aidan Gillen.

programme.title: Life Itself
programme.desc: After falling in love at college, New Yorkers Will and Abby marry and prepare for parenthood. Meanwhile, fate links them to a group of people in Seville, Spain, including a troubled young woman. Drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Olivia Wilde and Annette Bening.

programme.title: May December
programme.desc: Twenty years after their notorious tabloid romance gripped the nation, a married couple buckles under pressure when an actress arrives to do research for a film about their past. Director Todd Haynes' drama, starring Natalie Portman, Chris Tenzis and Julianne Moore.

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: Aporia
programme.desc: Since losing her husband, Sophie has juggled grief, a full-time job, and parenting her devastated daughter. However, when a former physicist reveals a covert time-bending machine, the widow is faced with a difficult choice. Writer/director Jared Moshe's sci-fi drama, starring Judy Greer and Edi Gathegi.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: In Mexico, a young woman flees to the US after her flamenco dancer mother is killed by drug cartel thugs. She crosses paths with Aidan, an ex-marine, and together they go on the run. Director Benjamin Millepied's musical reimagining of Georges Bizet's opera, starring Melissa Barrera and Paul Mescal.

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: Wallace is a medical school drop-out who has given up on love after a series of bad break-ups, while Chantry is an animator who lives with her boyfriend. The two become friends since neither is interested in a relationship with the other - but as they grow closer, they begin to wonder if they belong together. Romantic drama, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.(n)

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: The Survivor
programme.desc: Drama based on the story of Harry Haft, a survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp who boxed his fellow inmates to stay alive. Haunted by memories and guilt, he attempts to use high-profile fights against boxing legends like Rocky Marciano as a way to find his first love again. Directed by Barry Levinson and starring Ben Foster, John Leguizamo, Peter Sarsgaard and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.(n)

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.(n)

programme.title: The Survivor
programme.desc: Drama based on the story of Harry Haft, a survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp who boxed his fellow inmates to stay alive. Haunted by memories and guilt, he attempts to use high-profile fights against boxing legends like Rocky Marciano as a way to find his first love again. Directed by Barry Levinson and starring Ben Foster, John Leguizamo, Peter Sarsgaard and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Meanwhile, a seasoned cowboy goes on the run with a prostitute and a young lad after killing a fellow gunman. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventure, starring Zachary Levi, Lil Rel Howery, Zooey Deschanel and Benjamin Bottani.(n)

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.(n)

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Estranged childhood friends Heather and Carla reunite for a cup of tea after not having spoken in many years. At their meeting, Heather presents an unexpected proposition that will change their lives forever. Director Guillem Morales' thriller, starring Naomie Harris and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Estranged childhood friends Heather and Carla reunite for a cup of tea after not having spoken in many years. At their meeting, Heather presents an unexpected proposition that will change their lives forever. Director Guillem Morales' thriller, starring Naomie Harris and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Blood For Dust
programme.desc: A travelling salesman drowning under the weight of providing for his family finds himself on a dangerous path after a chance encounter with a colleague. Action thriller, starring Scoot McNairy, Kit Harington, Josh Lucas and Ethan Suplee.(n)

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: An ex-convict returns to his home town in north-west China, where he joins a patrol clearing the streets of dogs ahead of the 2008 Olympics. Before long, he bonds with one of the strays and the two lonely souls embark on a new journey together. Drama, starring Eddie Peng. In Mandarin.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Women Oscar Winners
programme.desc: Highlighting female Oscar winners across the categories, from iconic leading ladies to women trailblazing behind the scenes.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.(c)

programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' whimsical, sextuple Oscar-winning fable stars Tom Hanks as an extraordinary man who leads a charmed existence over four turbulent decades of US history.

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A man is thrown into the brutality of prison life when he gets two life sentences for a crime he claims he didn't commit. Drama starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily's abusive relationship is shaken after her first love reappears. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Adaptation of the hit book starring Emily Blunt as an alcoholic divorcee caught up in a missing person case that sends shockwaves throughout her life.

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt. During the Second World War, American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and fellow scientists race against time to develop an atomic bomb before the Nazis. But, during the 1950s Red Scare, his name is dragged through the mud by US officials.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. Decades later, Winton's records of the mission reawaken painful memories of the youngsters he couldn't save - and set him on an unexpected path to laying h

programme.title: The Wolf of Wall Street
programme.desc: Blackly comic drama based on a true story, starring Leonardo DiCaprio. With his dreams of wealth and a gift with words, Jordan Belfort rises through the ranks of Wall Street traders during the 1980s. But his success brings notoriety, and his increasingly shady activities attract the attention of the FBI.

programme.title: The Secret Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter and his younger sister Verity move into a new house and struggle to acclimatise to their surroundings in an emotionally unsettling period for their family. The children tumble into a cavernous space beneath their bedroom and are greeted by an army of pangolins, who decree Peter their ruler. Fantasy adventure, starring Sam Everingham and Alyla Browne.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: Road movie starring Jamie Flatters and Keenan Munn-Francis. Outgoing London teen Nathan stumbles across his shy school friend Sam being mugged and leaps in to save him. Discovering that they are both planning to travel north, Sam offers Nathan a seat in his car.

programme.title: Moving On
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin. At the funeral for an old friend, Claire approaches the deceased's widower and states that she intends to murder him in revenge for something terrible he did decades ago. Claire then reconnects with her estranged college pal, Evelyn, who agrees to help out - if only to see if Claire really follows through...

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dac

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Adam Sandler, Kate Beckinsale and Christopher Walken. Architect Michael Newman's will to succeed at work has come at the expense of quality time with his beautiful wife and children. But then Michael comes into possession of a remote control that allows him to pause, rewind and fast-forward his life just as he pleases.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling. When blonde and bubbly Barbie experiences a series of sudden crises, she must leave Barbieland to track down her human owner and make things right. But the adoring Ken follows her to Los Angeles where he discovers something called the "patriarchy" and develops some radical ideas...

programme.title: Monolith
programme.desc: A disgraced journalist attempts to save her career by turning to investigative podcasting. She soon starts to wonder if a strange artefact is linked to an alien conspiracy, or whether she is losing her mind. Director Matt Vesely's thriller, starring Lily Sullivan.

programme.title: Arcadian
programme.desc: Action horror starring Nicolas Cage. Following an apocalyptic event, single father Paul lives with his two teenage sons on an isolated homestead, forced to hide every night from the nocturnal monsters that stalk the outdoors. Though the trio has settled into a relatively stable routine, their lives are threatened when the creatures start working out how to get inside...

programme.title: Hypnotic
programme.desc: Police detective Danny Rourke is haunted by the abduction of his seven-year-old daughter Minnie from a park. During a bank heist, Danny discovers a photo of his daughter with an instruction to find someone called Dell Rayne. Evidence leads to a psychic Diana Cruz, who introduces the cop to the unseen world of hypnotics - people with the ability to control how we perceive the world. Action thriller

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Comedy starring Rowan Atkinson as the accident-prone Mr Bean. In an attempt to get rid of him from his job as one of their attendants, the governors of the National Gallery send Mr Bean to America to represent them at the unveiling of the Grierson Gallery's new purchase. Needless to say disaster is never far away.

programme.title: Mr Bean's Holiday
programme.desc: Comedy starring Rowan Atkinson. Mr Bean puts the entente cordiale under considerable strain when he wins a camcorder and a trip to France in a raffle. After a typically accident-prone encounter with a Russian film director, the hapless hero ends up at the Cannes film festival.

programme.desc: Lao Luo is a washed-up stuntman with a deformed horse called Red Hare, who he saved from euthanasia. The duo become overnight sensations when a fight with debt collectors goes viral. Writer/director Larry Yang's action drama, starring Jackie Chan, Liu Haocun and Kevin Guo. In Mandarin, with subtitles.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure sequel based on the popular 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu. When the special agents investigate a series of deaths connected to the Federal Witness Protection Programme, they discover evidence that points to "fallen" Angel Madison Lee.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: Flow
programme.desc: Cat is a solitary animal, but as its home is devastated by a great flood, he finds refuge on a boat populated by various species, and will have to team up with them despite their differences.

programme.title: The White Lotus
programme.desc: In the wake of the festivities, Laurie finds herself feeling deceived by Jaclyn, while Saxon tries to bury what happened the night before.

programme.title: Sing Sing
programme.desc: Based on the true story of a man imprisoned at Sing Sing for a crime he didn't commit. When joined by a wary outsider, he finds purpose staging an original comedy with a theater group of other incarcerated men.

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct.

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two detectives uncover a conspiracy involving a drug kingpin while trying to stop the trafficking of Ecstasy in Miami.

programme.title: How We Get Free
programme.desc: Over the course of two years, Elisabeth Epps works to end cash bail on all fronts, from bailing people out of jail to running for office as one of the first abolitionist candidates in Colorado.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical
programme.desc: Jenna Hunterson is a waitress and expert pie maker stuck in a small town and a loveless marriage. When a baking contest offers her a chance at escape, Jenna fights to reclaim part of herself.

programme.title: Celtics City
programme.desc: As the Boston Celtics celebrate their record 18th NBA title, the franchise's origins are traced back; Red Auerbach makes history by drafting Chuck Cooper, the NBA's first Black player; racial tensions bring a tumultuous era ahead.

programme.title: Celtics City
programme.desc: At the peak of the civil rights movement, with segregation persisting in Boston, Bill Russell inserts himself into the struggle; yet the winning continues, with Russell making more history.

programme.title: Celtics City
programme.desc: Against the backdrop of the controversial Boston busing mandate and racial unrest in the city, the Celtics return to glory with a pair of championships in the 1970's; the team fades before Auerbach pulls off another brilliant move.

programme.title: Celtics City
programme.desc: Larry Bird arrives in Boston as a beacon of hope; his rivalry with Magic Johnson help revive a struggling NBA; Bird helps lead the Celtics to their 14th championship in 1981; internal discord threatens to derail another potential dynasty.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Back in Los Angeles, fugitive Dom Toretto (Vin Diesel) and agent Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) reignite their feud but, then, must join forces against a common enemy.

programme.title: The White Lotus
programme.desc: In the wake of the festivities, Laurie finds herself feeling deceived by Jaclyn, while Saxon tries to bury what happened the night before.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: The Righteous Gemstones
programme.desc: Following three generations of a famous televangelist family with a tradition of charitable work, deviance and greed.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.desc: In the wake of the festivities, Laurie finds herself feeling deceived by Jaclyn, while Saxon tries to bury what happened the night before.

programme.title: Justice League

programme.title: The Nut Job

programme.title: Rio

programme.title: Being Mary Tyler Moore

programme.desc: Treasure hunter Victor Sullivan recruits Nathan Drake to help him recover a 500-year-old fortune. What starts out as a heist becomes a globe-trotting, white-knuckle race to reach the prize before the ruthless Santiago Moncada can get his hands on it.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: After a wild stag party in Las Vegas, three hazy groomsmen (Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis) must find their missing friend and get him back to Los Angeles in time for his wedding.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: Two male FBI agents (Shawn Wayans, Marlon Wayans) pose as female socialites to foil a kidnapping plot and save their jobs.

programme.title: The Disaster Artist
programme.desc: The incredible true story of aspiring filmmaker and Hollywood outsider Tommy Wiseau as he and his best friend defiantly pursue their dreams and embark on the hilarious odyssey of making the now-infamous, cult classic "The Room.".

programme.title: Casablanca
programme.desc: A cynical nightclub owner (Humphrey Bogart) protects an old flame (Ingrid Bergman) and her husband (Paul Henreid) from Nazis in Morocco.

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's footsteps, Rusty Griswold takes his wife and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Guided by a rebellious and charismatic coach (Hugh Jackman), British ski jumper Michael "Eddie" Edwards (Taron Egerton) trains for the 1988 Winter Olympics in Calgary, Alberta.

programme.title: You Were My First Boyfriend
programme.desc: Filmmaker Cecilia Aldarondo revisits her 1990s adolescence, a generation after she thought she'd left it all behind.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part One
programme.desc: The Anti-Monitor (the Monitor's evil counterpart) is released into the DC Multiverse and begins to destroy the different Earths that compose it. The Monitor attempts to recruit heroes from across the Multiverse to fight back.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part Two
programme.desc: An endless army of shadow demons threatens to destroy the world and all parallel Earths. The only thing opposing them is the mighty combined power of Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern and all their fellow superheroes.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part Three
programme.desc: The Anti-Monitor attacks the remaining Earths and their inhabitants. Heroes and villains across time and space join the Justice League for a final stand against the epitome of evil.

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: A king (Dominic Cooper), a mighty warrior (Travis Fimmel) and a powerful wizard (Ben Foster) unite to defend the human realm of Azeroth from a tyrannical shaman (Daniel Wu) and his invading army of orcs.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.
